page.title: 12Housing
page.content: Housing in Woodley and Whistley Green shows great variety. Some is quite old one even has no electricity. Many business people have moved into the area to live. Houses are expensive _ from Â£40,000 upwards. There are very few council houses. Most of the houses are semi_detached/detached. There are 3 private housing estates and one council estate. The council estate borders on Sonning and the private estates are:_ between Western Ave and Butts Hill Rd; the area surrounding Willowbank School and finally, an area south of Twyford which includes Swans Crescent, Mallard Close, Woodpecker Close and Kingfisher Crescent. In contrast Whistley Green has no new housing development of any size, being surrounded by farmland. Hinton House is of historic interest and is now in use as a private school.
